[ST] Create PATCH /loc endpoint
[US] As an admin, I want to update or edit information that are stored for location in the database

card.desc:
### :notebook_with_decorative_cover: **To do:**

- User needs to get authenticated via our log in API
- User wants to edit existing location record in the application
  - Affected location records must be updated according to the given payload
- It must follow the uniqueness of city and state pairings
- The user must have a privilege of `manageLocs`
  - Only admins have this privilege:

---

### :point_right: **Input:**

- The following payload describes the given payload:
  - ```
    {
      "id": "sadasdfikh12123jb",
      "city": "quezon",
      "pop": 1103,
      "state": "manila",
      "loc": [34, -60]
    }
    ```
- The following format must be followed upon saving in Database
  - `city` : 25 char string, lower-case
  - `state` : 25 char string, lower-case
  - `pop` : 4 digit integer
  - `loc` : array of 2 elements, latitude, longitude
    - each must be 0 < \@ < 180
  - `id` : 25 char string, lower-case; id of the record

---

### :point_right: Output:

- 204 response code
- given payload must be reflected in the database for locations

card.desc:
### :notebook_with_decorative_cover: **To do:**

- User needs to get authenticated via our log in API
- User wants to delete locations existing in the application
  - Affected locations must be deleted in the application (hard-delete)
  - Unless, there are users in the location (relational delete constraint)
- The user must have a privilege of `manageLoc`
  - Only admins have this privilege

---

### :point_right: **Input:**

- The following payload describes the given payload:
  - ```json
    {
      "ids": ["asdf","fdsa"]
    }
    ```
- The following format must be followed upon deleting in database:
  - `ids`: object id of the location

---

### :point_right: Output:

- Following response must be followed:
  - ```
    {
      "counts": 23,
    }
    ```
- The following format must be followed upon deleting in database:
  - `counts`: number of locations deleted

Due to time constraints, payload was simplified to the following:

```
{
  "city": "quezon",
  "pop": 1103,
  "state": "manila",
  "loc": [34, -60]
}
```

‌

where the formats are:

- `city` : 25 char string, lower-case
- `state` : 25 char string, lower-case
- `pop` : 4 digit integer
- `loc` : array of 2 elements, latitude, longitude
  - each must be -180 < \@ < 180

card.desc:
### :notebook_with_decorative_cover: **To do:**

- User needs to get authenticated via our log in API
- User wants to edit existing location record in the application
  - Affected location records must be updated according to the given payload
- It must follow the uniqueness of city and state pairings
- The user must have a privilege of `manageUser`
  - Only admins have this privilege:

---

### :point_right: **Input:**

- The following payload describes the given payload:
  - ```
    {
      "id": "sadasdfikh12123jb",
      "city": "quezon",
      "pop": 1103,
      "state": "manila",
      "loc": [34, -60]
    }
    ```
- The following format must be followed upon saving in Database
  - `city` : 25 char string, lower-case
  - `state` : 25 char string, lower-case
  - `pop` : 4 digit integer
  - `loc` : array of 2 elements, latitude, longitude
    - each must be 0 < \@ < 180
  - `id` : 25 char string, lower-case; id of the record

---

### :point_right: Output:

- 204 response code
- given payload must be reflected in the database for locations

### :notebook_with_decorative_cover: **To do:**

- User needs to get authenticated via our log in API
- User wants to edit existing user record in the application
  - Affected user records must be updated according to the given payload
- It must follow the uniqueness constraints for emails
- Updating location should only reference existing record
  - meaning, it shouldn’t update in locations but use an existing one
- The user must have a privilege of `manageUser`
  - Only admins have this privilege:

---

### :point_right: **Input:**

- The following payload describes the given payload:
  - ```json
    {
      "id": "asljdkh235bsadlkjdfgh"
      "firstName": "harjit",
      "lastName": "brar",
      "email": "harjitbrar07@gmail.com",
      "location": {
        "city": "quezon",
        "state": "manila"
      }
    }
    ```
- The following format must be followed upon saving in Database
  - `firstName`: 25 char string, lower-case
  - `lastName`: 25 char string, lower-case
  - `email`: 25 char string, lower-case, email format
  - `location`:
    - `state`: 25 chars, lower cased
    - `city`: 25 chars, lower cased
  - `id`: 20 chars, lower-cased

---

### :point_right: Output:

- 204 response code
- given payload must reflect in the database

card.name: [ST] Back-end development

card.desc:
### :mag: Acceptance Criteria

- properly implement oauth2.0 style of google
- should be able to authenticate with a google account
- redirection should be successful
  - with authorization token
  - goes back to swagger or can be simulated in swagger
- user detail should be retrievable from google server
- should be able to cache the user in memcache and use it
- user should be inserted in DB

---

### :notebook_with_decorative_cover: Notes:

- some useful resources I found:
  - [Implementing Google OAuth2 Authentication in Node.js project using passport: A Step-by-Step Guide](https://blog.bitsrc.io/implementing-google-oauth2-authentication-in-node-js-project-using-passport-a-step-by-step-guide-c5e38e9f6071 "‌")
  - [Implementing Authentication in NodeJS App using OAuth2.0](https://codeculturepro.medium.com/implementing-authentication-in-nodejs-app-using-oauth2-0-59fee8f63798 "‌")
  - [Documentation: Google (passportjs.org)](https://www.passportjs.org/concepts/authentication/google/ "‌")
  - [https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/security/oauth/oauth-introduction#:~:text=%22The%20OAuth%202.0%20authorization%20framework,obtain%20access%20on%20its%20own](https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/security/oauth/oauth-introduction#:~:text=%22The%20OAuth%202.0%20authorization%20framework,obtain%20access%20on%20its%20own "smartCard-inline")
  - [javascript - Understanding the Purpose of Access and Refresh Tokens in passport-google-oauth20 with NestJS - Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75811860/understanding-the-purpose-of-access-and-refresh-tokens-in-passport-google-oauth2 "‌")
  - [Google OAuth 2.0 Access Token and Refresh Token Explained | by Paul Kenjora At Google | StarThinker | Medium](https://medium.com/starthinker/google-oauth-2-0-access-token-and-refresh-token-explained-cccf2fc0a6d9 "‌")
  - [Passport Google Login and the Refresh Token (brandonlehr.com)](https://brandonlehr.com/passport-js/google-login/2017/07/10/passport-google-login-refresh-token "‌")
  - [Session Management in Nodejs Using Redis as Session Store | by Chamith Madusanka | The Startup | Medium](https://medium.com/swlh/session-management-in-nodejs-using-redis-as-session-store-64186112aa9 "‌")
  - [Improve Your Debugging experience in Visual Studio Code | by Yogesh Chavan | JavaScript in Plain English](https://javascript.plainenglish.io/useful-feature-added-in-visual-studio-code-that-you-might-not-be-aware-of-284c237daf3 "‌")
  - [What is OAuth 2.0 and what does it mean? - Kinde](https://kinde.com/guides/authentication/protocols/oauth-20/ "‌")
  - [OAuth 2.0 (swagger.io)](https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/oauth2/ "‌")

Following are the items I want to achieve in this ticket:

[X] : I want to implement an OAuth2.0 style of authentication (ex. google)

[X] : I want to implement a caching system to speed up the process

[X] : I want to store the user data in my storage for refresh token and for other business logic (need to do refresh token)

[ ] : I want to have a proper simulation with Swagger and Oauth2.0

listing.description:
![Status](https://api.amazingpowerups.com/api/status/amazing-fields)

---
# Make Trello Fit Your Workflow Needs

**How Does It Help You?**

   * ⚙️ **Customize Trello to work in the way you need:** use Amazing Fields to make Trello work for your workflow leveraging easy to use customization.
   * 🗃️ **Organize data in ways that make sense to you and your team:** keep your data and information organized without sacrificing the power of Trello.
   * 🪄 **Add fields with better visuals and more customization than Trello alone:** choose from hundreds of different combinations and features to build exactly what you need.
   * 🔎 **Collect field data on the Trello free plan:** allows fields and customization for free on both Trello free and premium plans.

---

## Join Over 175,000+ Happy Users

Testimonials sent in by users:

  * "It offers to customize EVERYTHING on the fields, it is **what Trello was missing**." - Ana H

  * "I appreciate the continuing updates and responses to my questions from the maintainer.  It **wasn't just a power-up that was made and forgotten about**." - Michael E

  * "It **answered my most annoying problems** with the Trello workflow." - **Ville K**

  * "I can't believe there aren't more apps that offer these features -- **so well done** and thank you so much for developing this!!" - **Cathi B**

  * "This is **one of the best powerups on Trello** I have found in my last 10+ years of using Trello boards. Simply Amazing!!!" - **Yogesh B**

  * "Your Power Up is **awesome**! It should be named Awesome Fields!!" - **Gisele P**


---
## Awards & Recognition

🚀 [Awarded](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/power-up-stats-2022/) Fastest growing PowerUp of 2022!!

🎖️ [Awarded](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/power-up-stats-2021/) #1 New Trello PowerUp of 2021!!

ℹ️ Referenced >100 times by the [Trello community](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/forums/searchpage/tab/message?advanced=false&allow_punctuation=false&q=%22amazing+fields%22)

🗣️ Featured frequently on [How I Trello](https://trello.substack.com/)

----
## What Sets Amazing Fields Apart

I built and refined Amazing Fields based upon feedback from users.  I think this has set Amazing Fields apart from other Trello powerups.

  * **Project Activity:** Amazing Fields is under active development. It was not released and then forgotten about. There are frequent updates providing new fixes and features based upon user feedback.  See the [Amazing Fields Changelog](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/38-amazing-fields-powerup-changelog).

  * **Cost:** I want as many people to use Amazing Fields as possible. It is **freely available for use on as many boards and workspaces as you need**.  See the Supporters section below for more details.

  * **Support:** My goal is to provide the best support of any Trello powerup.  The [Amazing Fields documentation site](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/) has a wide range of articles with more added all the time.  You can also contact me through the support widget in the powerup or email directly at [support@amazingpowerups.com][1].

  * **Security and Data Protection:** Your data is safe and secure on the [Trello trusted servers](https://trello.com/trust).  I have no remote access to your boards or data.


----

![Overview Image](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amazing_fields_overall_guide.png)

**All the options you always wanted to customize Trello but didn’t know to ask**

As a long time users of Trello, I wanted to break out of the limits of the standard workflow and limited data options.  I wanted all the features I have grown to expect from other tools like **formulas**, **customized formatting**, **conditional styling**, **selectable icons**, **easy exports**, and even **progress bars**. I built this powerup to meet my needs and yours as well.

It includes everything you could want:

   * **Field display options** - show on front or back with optional labels and width
   * **Hide Fields** - show only the fields that are needed for each card
   * **Conditional coloring** - change the badge color based upon field values
   * **Reorder fields** - easily reorder fields live for full control
   * **Permissions** - restrict view and edit by user type
   * **Text fields** - collect key information that you need for each card.
   * **Numbers** - track metrics like story points, counts, or any other numbers
   * **Checkbox** - support tracking any on/off style values
   * **Dates** - collect key dates and times to show on the cards
   * **Dropdown** - create a list of preset values and let users choose one or multiple
   * **Formulas** - calculate the value of fields from other field values
   * **Card References** - allow cards reference cards on other boards
   * **Per card visibility** - choose which fields are shown per card
   * **Number formatting** - currency, scientific, percents, accounting and more
   * **Date formatting** - choose everything about how you want to show the date
   * **Progress bars** - use multiple styles to track progress
   * **Multi-select dropdowns** - select multiple items from a dropdown
   * **Checkbox styles** - select from several types of checkboxes
   * **Constraints** - constrain input to specific format templates
   * **Board Exporting** - export all your board and field data to load in a spreadsheet
   * **Text Constraints** - require text fields to match patterns (email, URL, custom...)
   * **Advanced editors** - go beyond the basic field editors
   * **Custom Fields** - ability to integrate with Trello custom fields for automation
   * **Board Backups** - automatically create backups of boards and data
   * And more… - send [new ideas][1]

If there is anything you want and don’t see, [contact me][1] to suggest something new.

---
# Templates / Examples

Take a look at these templates to see what is possible with Amazing Fields. Click on "Create board from template" after you open the links and then click on the "Fields" board button to see the Amazing Fields settings.

   * Feature Examples
      * [Field Features](https://trello.com/b/hGdps9W6)
      * [Progress Bars](https://trello.com/b/0qk7eYed)
      * [Formula Calculations](https://trello.com/b/IGvcw1r5)
   * Usage Examples
      * [Personal Todo](https://trello.com/b/WA8LoWrA)
      * [Amazing Kanban](https://trello.com/b/61fd9fb4107f3075b688c7ca)


# Getting Started

There are a few short steps to get started using the Amazing Fields PowerUp.

See the Amazing Fields docs site for a full walk-thru:

  * [Getting Started](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/18-getting-started)

---

# Details

## Calculated Fields 🖥️

Create formulas just like you do in a spreadsheet to calculate field values from each other.  Supports 100+ of the most common spreadsheet functions.

## Choose Fields to Show Per Card

Make every card just the way you want it by choosing which fields to show. When you copy a card or use a card template, it keeps track of the fields you want to show.

![Field Filter Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_visibility_video.gif)

## Progress Bars 📊

Have you ever wanted to see progress towards a goal on your cards?  Configure the style, width, range and more.  There is support for custom progress bars so you can create anything you imagine.

![Progress Bars Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/progress-bar-fields-linux.png)

You can even setup a progress bar to "link" to the checklists on your card to show a styled progress bar as you make progress on your tasks.

![Checklist Progress Bars](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_checklist_links_video.gif)


## Date Formatting 📅

Choose exactly how you want dates to show on cards.  Dates and times are show in internationalized formats with over 40 variations supported.  Let me know if there is another option that you need.

![Date Formatting Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/date-fields-linux.png)

## Number Formatting 🧮

Select from any combination of number formatting.  All numbers are displayed in the correct  international format, and you can change the number of decimal places in the number.

![Number Formatting Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/number-fields-linux.png)

## Currency Support 💰

Choose to use any of 150+ currency types from around the world.

## Accounting Format 🧾

Supports styling in accounting format to display negative numbers clearly for accountants on your team.


## Customized Checkboxes ☑️

No more being restricted to a single boring check style.  Select from a wide range of options. Every aspect of how you show it is up to you to choose.  Let me know if there are more styles or options I can add to support your use case.

![Checkboxes Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/boolean-fields-linux.png)

## Dropdown Lists

Create a dropdown to choose from a list of choices along with colors to use to decorate the choices.  Very useful for things like card tags, workflow stages, categories, ratings, etc.  You can select one item or multiple items.

![List Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/dropdown_lists.gif)

## Field Display Options 🕵️

You can choose where and how you want your fields to be displayed.  Choose if they should show on the front, the back, or both. Also choose if the field should be labeled or stand alone.

![Display Options Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/field_display_options.gif)

## Tabbed Sections and Headers

Organize fields using section headers and tabs.

![Tabs and Sections Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_tabs_headers_video.gif)


## Rule Based Coloring 🎨

Don't use the same boring colors for your fields.  Use formatting rules to set the color based on field values.  You can color progress bars based upon percentage completed, highlight text fields based upon content, monitor key dates, and highlight key checkbox values.  [Let me know][1] if you need a new rule and I will add it for you.

![Rule Coloring](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/rule_based_coloring.gif)

## Text Template Constraints

Setup templates to restrict text input to specific formats (eg. email, phone numbers, URLs, time durations, part numbers, ticket id, etc).  Amazing Fields comes with preset options and lets you define your own as needed.

Need a new preset, [let me know][1].

## Card References

Card references let you connect cards across boards. For example have your project cards reference customer cards or project team members. This lets you build up your boards as databases of cards that can connect in any way you need.

![Card References](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_card_refs_video.gif)

## Custom Editors

No more ugly editors. Immediately see any conditional formatting and visually distinguish the fields.  When you change a value on a progress bar, see it immediately.  If you click on a checkbox you see the custom styled icons.

Even adjust the layout of editors. Set how wide the editors should be and change the way they are labeled.

![Custom Editors](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/custom-editors-linux.png)

## Customize Permissions Per Field

Want to hide some fields from non-administrators or restrict who can edit or view a field?  I built on top of the existing Trello permissions model to let you determine who view/edit each field.  You can require a specific user type or user.  This enables a whole new class of advanced workflows for sharing data across your boards.

![Field Permissions](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/field_permissions.png)

## Exporting Card Data 📋

Amazing Fields allows you to export all the cards on the board including their field data to a CSV file.  This can be loaded in Excel, Google Sheets, or other spreadsheet software for further processing and analysis of your data. You can use this to export both Amazing Fields data or simply to export your normal card data.

## Board Backup

Configure automated backups for your board and all data.  Keep everything safe and secure within your Trello account for easy disaster recovery and archival.

## Custom Field Integration 🤖

As you use fields more, you may want to integrate them into core Trello capabilities like automations, filtering, reporting, and the Trello mobile or integrate with tools like Zapier or other powerups.  Powerups can't directly interface with these capabilities so Amazing Fields lets you link a field to a custom field.  Anytime you change the Amazing Field content it updates the custom field and similarly when you change the value of the custom field it updates the Amazing Field.  This all happens automatically for you behind the scenes.

There are also browser extensions provided to hide the linked custom fields and keep your UI amazingly clean.

---
# Limitations

I hope Amazing Fields does everything you need, but I know there are some use cases where you may need a different tool.

The primary limitation people ask about is that some advanced capabilities like automations and third-party integrations require the use of a paid Trello account.  Trello charges for those features and Amazing Fields does not try to circumvent that.  Instead you need to get a Trello paid plan and link your Amazing Fields to a custom field.

---
# Alternatives

I am glad that you found Amazing Fields, but I know there are other powerups you may be considering for adding data to your cards.

**Trello Custom Fields**: Trello paid plans have support for adding Custom Fields.  These allow you to add basic data to your cards and support automations.  In comparison, Amazing Fields is more focused on advanced features like formulas, formatting, presentation, and customizing fields.

**Smart Fields**: The [Smart Fields](https://trello.com/power-ups/5e2212c3ba57415ef2ef9352) power up allows adding fields to cards.  It's primary focus on on calculations.  In comparison, Amazing Fields not only supports formulas, but also improved data entry, customization, and presentation of field data.

---
# Supporters

Amazing Fields is **freely available for use by as many users, boards, and workspaces as you need**.  There are no limits on it's use.  Once fields are configured and setup they can be used by as many people as you would like on as many boards and workspaces as you need.

I ask that users who feel they are getting value out of Amazing Fields consider becoming a supporter to help me cover the cost of maintenance and hosting the powerup.  Most users do not become supporters, but I greatly appreciate the ones that are. For ~$4/month it helps me ensure the quality of this powerup.

As a way to thank supporters, there are a small set of power user capabilities that require a supporter to configure.  The features are still **completely free** for use by any number of users, boards, and workspaces.

For more details, see this support article: [Amazing Fields Supporters](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/20-amazing-fields-supporters)

If you become a supporter and don't find the additional capabilities useful, just email [support@amazingpowerups.com][1] for a no-questions-asked refund.  I want users to enjoy Amazing Fields. If it isn't working well for you just let me know.

# Contact

To get help or suggest a new features, please contact me directly at [support@amazingpowerups.com][1].  I love feedback and will get back to you as quickly as possible.


# Links
   * [Product Page](https://amazingpowerups.com/product/amazing-fields/)
   * [Documentation / Support](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/)
   * [Privacy Policy](https://amazingpowerups.com/privacy-policy/)
   * [Contact Support][1]


# Release History

Amazing Fields is under active development.  For a full list of changes see: [Amazing Fields Changelog](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/38-amazing-fields-powerup-changelog)

[1]: mailto:support@amazingpowerups.com

### :notebook_with_decorative_cover: **To do:**

- The user wants to get the list of locations stored in the applications along with the number of populations on each.
- The user must have a `getGeneral` privilege.
  - All users have this.

---

### :point_right: **Input:**

- Just a GET request with no payload nor parameter

---

### :point_right: Output:

- List of locations with their details along with the counts of users in that location
- We must count users that are registered in our application.
- We must provide two counts: One, for non-google and other for google users.
- There must be a total count of the two.

card.desc:
### :notebook_with_decorative_cover: **To do:**

- The user wants to add a new user in the Application.
  - A new record must be created for the user given the payload.
- The user must have the privilege of `manageUsers`
  - Only admins have this privilege.
- Newly created users will have empty values for their google id properties.

---

### :point_right: **Input:**

- The following payload describes a new user:
  - ```json
    {
      "first-name": "Harjit",
      "middle-name": "Singh",
      "last-name": "Brar",
      "mobile-number": "091235523433"
      "birth-date": "09/19/1997",
      "resident-address": {
        "line-1": "TB 1607 MPlace Residences"
        "line-2": "South triangle"
        "city": "Quezon city"
        "zip": "1103"
      }
      "id": "2024068947"
      "id-type": "student-id"
    }
    ```
- The following format must be followed upon saving in Database
  - `first-name`: 25 char string, lower-case
  - `middle-name`: 25 char string, lower-case
  - `last-name`: 25 char string, lower-case
  - `birth-date`: `LocalDate`
  - `resident-address`:
    - `line-1`: 50 chars, lower cased
    - `line-2`: 50 chars, lower cased
    - `city`: 25 chars, lower cased
    - `zip`: number 5 digits
  - `id`: 20 chars, lower-cased
  - `id-type`: 15 chars, upper case; must be the following:
    - PASSPORT
    - STUDENT-ID
    - DRIVER-ID
    - GOV-ID

---

### :point_right: Output:

- 204 response code
- new record must be in the list of users
card.name: [US] As admin user, I want to be able to add a user in the Application.

---

- 204 response code
- new record must be in the list of locations

- User needs to get authenticated via google using auth2 method.
- User details will be saved in the database as they log in.
  - Application must check for duplicate entries upon saving.
  - Application must validate data upon saving.
- Access tokens must be saved in Memcached for optimization.
  - Application must use the user object from google for caching.

---

### :point_right: **Input:**

- POST API request for authenticating the user.
- payload:
  ```json
  ‌<TBD>
  ```

### :point_right: Output:

- User must be authenticated until their token or session expires.
  - User must have an access token or session id with expiry time.

listing.name: Time tracker by Tracking Time
listing.description:
# Add Time Tracking to your Trello Boards!
With TrackingTime, you can easily track the time you spend on each Trello card, project, and board, giving you a better understanding of how your team is managing their time and where you need to make improvements. 
Simple and intuitive to use!

 ![Trello preview](https://trackingtime.co/trello/trello.gif)

- - - -
## Top features:
 ![Time Blocking](https://trackingtime.co/trello/calendar-app.png)

### Time Blocking: 
Allows users to schedule and block out specific periods of time for different tasks or projects. By setting aside dedicated time for each task, users can better manage their time and ensure that they are making progress on their most important projects. Time blocking also helps to eliminate distractions and maintain focus, which can be particularly useful for users who struggle with productivity or procrastination. Additionally, TrackingTime’s time blocking feature can be synced with users’ calendars, allowing them to easily manage their schedule and avoid conflicts.

### One-click time tracking
Simple and intuitive interface that allows users to start and stop timers with just one click. This makes it easy to track the time you spend on each task or project, without the need for manual data entry or complex time tracking software.

### Detailed reporting
Detailed reports that show how much time has been spent on each task or project, as well as how team members are using their time. These reports can be customized and exported in a variety of formats, making it easy to share with clients, managers, or team members. Additionally, the tool offers insights and analytics that can help users identify areas for improvement and optimize their workflow.

### Attendance and work schedule management
Manage attendance and work schedules. Users can set up schedules for themselves or their team members, and track attendance and time off requests. This makes it easy to ensure that everyone is on the same page and that work schedules are being followed effectively. Additionally, the tool can generate reports that show attendance data and help with payroll processing.

- - - -

## Best for:
**Freelancers and small business owners**:  who need to keep track of their time for billing and invoicing purposes. By using the tool, they can easily track the time they spend on each project and task, and generate detailed reports to share with clients or use for accounting purposes.


**Project managers and team leaders**:  who need to manage their team’s time and projects efficiently. With TrackingTime, they can assign tasks and collaborate with team members in real-time in Trello, making it easier to keep projects on schedule and within budget.

**Remote workers and distributed teams**:  it can be challenging to keep track of their time and collaborate effectively with team members who are not in the same location. TrackingTime can help by providing a centralized platform for time reporting, while using collaborating in Trello.

 ![Track on any device](https://trackingtime.co/trello/mobile-time-tracker-screenshot.png)

- - - -

## To install the TrackingTime Trello power-up, follow these steps:
1. Open Trello and log in to your account.
2. Click on the board where you want to install the TrackingTime power-up.
3. Click on the “Power-Ups” button in the top right corner of the screen.
4. In the search bar, type “TrackingTime” and press Enter.
5. Click on the “Add” button next to the TrackingTime power-up.
6. Follow the on-screen instructions to connect your TrackingTime account to Trello.
7. Once the power-up is installed, you’ll see a new button labeled “Track Time” on each card in your Trello board. Click on this button to start tracking time for that card.

_That’s it! You’ve now installed the TrackingTime power-up and can start using it to track your time in Trello._

## Links
[Users love us](https://www.g2.com/products/trackingtime-pro/reviews)
[Our website](https://trackingtime.co)
[Pricing](https://trackingtime.co/pricing)
[Help center](https://support.trackingtime.co/)
listing.overview: Simple Time Tracking for Trello. Easily track your Trello Cards and get automatic timesheets 🥹

listing.name: Time Tracker by TimeCamp
listing.description:
#Track time in Trello cards with one click ⏱️ 

Enable the [TimeCamp time tracking Power-Up](https://www.timecamp.com/integrations/trello-time-tracking/) to gain the ability to track time and generate time reports on any card. Toggle the TimeCamp button on your cards to track time automatically. Most useful for projects that need to gain insights about how much time things take to accomplish. Harvest your timesheet with TimeCamp.

##How to start

- Add the Time Tracker by TimeCamp Power-Up in Trello
- Open the Power-Up settings and choose "Edit Power-Up settings".
- Sign in or sign up to TimeCamp
If you're signing up:
- Register new account
- Authorize the integration
- Select the boards you'd like to allow for tracking
- Choose card and start timer by Power-Up
- Track time with pleasure :)

##How it works

After enabling the Power-Up, the “Track Time” button will be added to your cards. You’ll also get the information about the time recorded for the card by different users. After the first time entry, TimeCamp Time Report will appear in the card.
![TimeCamp Power-Up](https://www.timecamp.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/powerup-trello-timecamp.gif)

##Use TimeCamp for free

You can use the Time Tracker Power-Up for free with the TimeCamp Free Plan. If you need more advanced features like invoicing or custom reports, check our paid plans.

Benefits of Free Plan:
✅ one integration available - use it for Trello :)
✅ unlimited users
✅ unlimited projects and tasks
✅ timesheets

What you get in Paid Plans:
✅ custom reports
✅ invoicing
✅ timesheet approvals
✅ unlimited integrations

Read more on our [pricing](https://www.timecamp.com/pricing/) page.

##Why users ❤️  TimeCamp

_I've been using Timecamp as an extension to Trello and it's made life so much easier. I can track time on a project at the click of a button and stop that timer in the very same way._
Ryan L., Digital Designer

_I use TimeCamp with Trello and it helps tremendously to keep my project on time and under budget. Seeing how long tasks are taking allows constant evaluation and improvement._
Valerian B., Managing Director

_There are a lot of time tracking options out there but TimeCamp provides low friction ways to get the job done. It syncs with a bunch of other project platforms which prevents the need for entering my projects in two systems._
Joel O., Consultant

listing.name: Toggl Integration for Trello
listing.description:
About
----------------

Toggl Integration for Trello is an easy way to operate with time entries without leaving a Trello board. You don't need to have any browser extension anymore to make it work.

---

Features
----------------
- Just copy-paste your Toggl API Token and you are ready to go.
- Start/stop timer inside a Trello card
- Update time entry description or easily append a checklist item to it.
- Select workspace, project, tags, billing options before the start
- Showing a badge about running timer on the front of card
- Remembers and preselects a timer options per user per board. Optionally it can be extended to a Trello column or card
- Basic work-log functionality
- Automatically start/stop a timer when Trello card is drag and drop to a specified column
- Switch plugin "license" from one board to another
- Two way synchronisation between Trello and Toggl
- Automatically assign card labels as Toggl tags

---

Price
----------------

All features are included in any subscription plan. 5 days trial.

- One board
  - 2€ per month if billed annually (3€ billed monthly)
- Up to 5 boards
  - 8€ per month if billed annually (9€ billed monthly)
  - Pay once and activate other boards from "License activation" section
- Unlimited count of boards
  - 14€ per month if billed annually (15€ billed monthly)
  - Pay once and activate other boards from "License activation" section

---

Support
----------------

If you have any feature suggestions or run into any problems, please get in touch with me by sending an email to tkostiushko@sm-act.com

---

Screenshots
----------------

[![Screenshot 1](https://trello-toggl.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/trello-toggl-2.png)](https://trello-toggl.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/trello-toggl-2.png)
[![Screenshot 2](https://trello-toggl.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/trello-toggl-3.png)](https://trello-toggl.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/trello-toggl-3.png)
[![Screenshot 3](https://trello-toggl.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/trello-toggl-1.png)](https://trello-toggl.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/trello-toggl-1.png)

listing.name: Time Tracking & Reporting
listing.description:
## 🕒 The easiest way for your team to log time directly in Trello##

Help your team log time on Trello cards to track work. Create and export reports to see aggregated data.

**New Feature** 
✅  Add a description to your work logs to gain a better understanding of the work performed.

This Power-Up was built ground up for Trello and is not an integration. Everything you need is inside your Trello board.

![Time Tracking & Reporting for Trello](https://orahapps-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/TT+Directory+Listing+gif+-+June+2021.gif)

To get started…

- Open a card, pick a date, a team member, add a description of the work, and log the number of hours spent. If you forget to log time, you can pick a date back in time or do it all at once at the end of the week. It works either way.
- Create reports grouped by cards or team members within a date range to get a detailed view on the project’s progress. You’ll see where hours have been spent, who’s worked on what, and which tasks have accumulated the most time. 
- Export reports into Excel or CSV for your records.

![Time Tracking & Reporting - Excel](https://time-tracking-trello.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/tt-excel.png)

This Power-Up is a time tracker tool for logging work and viewing reports. Useful for billing and invoicing clients, keeping up with accounting, resource planning, timesheets, seeing how much time has been spent on projects, and more. Export formats include Excel (XLSX) and CSV.

---

**Pricing:**
All users start on a 14-day free trial of the Power-up and can upgrade anytime to one of the below plans. 
- Annual billing: $96/year ($8/month) for one board with unlimited members
OR
- Monthly billing: $10/month for one board with unlimited members
We don’t charge per team member — you only pay for the boards you purchase a license for.

**Looking to purchase this Power-Up for 5+ boards? [Get in touch with us](https://productsupport.adaptavist.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/51) for pricing details.**

**FREE Trello Tutorials**
*Looking to do even more with Trello? Learn Trello tips, tricks, and automation with our [free video tutorials](https://bit.ly/3zQzi3c)*

##Legal
By using this Power-Up you agree to our [EULA](https://www.kolekti.com/kolekti-eula), [Terms and Conditions](https://www.theadaptavistgroup.com/policy/terms), and [Privacy Policy](https://www.kolekti.com/privacy-policy).

Get in touch on our [support portal](https://productsupport.adaptavist.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/51).

Learn more about Kolekti and our full suite of Trello Power-Ups [here](https://www.kolekti.com/products/trello).

![By Orah Apps](https://d24o7vf3n2hci.cloudfront.net/img/listings/time-tracking/trello-listing-pixel.png)
listing.overview: Track time by adding multiple work logs to each card with date, team member & hours spent. Create reports & export in Excel.

listing.name: Time Tracking Power-Up by Everhour
listing.description:
## Free & lightweight time tracking power-up for Trello

[![Video](https://everhour.com/assets/images/new-design/screens/trello-powerup/trello-powerup-youtube-cover.png)](https://youtu.be/ky-7-78wT4M?t=5)

## How to install
The power-up functions solely within Trello, **without the need for creating an Everhour account**.

- Click "Add Power-Up" button
- Select the boards you'd like to allow for tracking

## 🕒 How to track time
In the card details, you can track time using a timer or log time manually for any date. Board admins can report and manage time on behalf of other members.
￼
![Trello powerup - Add time](https://blog-cdn.everhour.com/assets/images/new-design/screens/trello-powerup/trello-powerup-time-tracking@2x.png)

## 👀 Time and estimates next to your cards
In the board view, next to the card title, you'll see if there is a running timer, total reported time, and the original estimate.
￼
![Trello powerup - Board view](https://blog-cdn.everhour.com/assets/images/new-design/screens/trello-powerup/trello-powerup-estimates@2x.png)

## 💰 Billable time and budgets
Easily designate tracked time as billable, set billable rates, and calculate total billable amounts per card, user, or board. Plus set specific budgets for individual cards, providing a convenient way to monitor progress.
￼
![Trello powerup - Billing](https://blog-cdn.everhour.com/assets/images/new-design/screens/trello-powerup/trello-powerup-billing-budget@2x.png)

## 📈 Detailed report and export to CSV
Click the "Time" button in the menu to display a table showing full time entries history. Filter by date, member, board or various additional properties. Save your current view, including applied filters and grouping, for instant access. Export data as a CSV file.
￼
![Trello powerup - Time report](https://blog-cdn.everhour.com/assets/images/new-design/screens/trello-powerup/trello-powerup-report-filters-advanced@2x.png)

## 🗓 Timesheet view
With the Timesheet tab, effortlessly review the reported time, neatly organized on a weekly basis for both you and your team, offering a comprehensive overview of your work.
￼
![Trello powerup - Timesheet](https://blog-cdn.everhour.com/assets/images/new-design/screens/trello-powerup/trello-powerup-timesheet@2x.png)

## ⚡ Quick summary
Moreover, with a single click, you can instantly view your ongoing progress by accessing the total time versus the estimated time for any column on the board, or for an employee or label.
￼
![Trello powerup - Quick summary](https://blog-cdn.everhour.com/assets/images/new-design/screens/trello-powerup/trello-powerup-quick-total@2x.png)

## 🏆 Packages

**FREE Plan**: Track time for any date. Set estimates, view reported time, and monitor progress against estimates. Enjoy these features for unlimited users and boards, absolutely free.

**PRO Plan**: At $10 per month (flat-rate), enjoy numerous additional features along with unlimited users and boards within one organization.

Additional features include:

- Cross-board reporting
- Admins can log time on others' behalf
- Advanced filters and grouping
- Custom date ranges
- Saved views
- Billable time
- Budgets
- Timesheet view
- Export data
- Email support

## Lastly
If your team is sizable and requires a more robust, feature-rich solution for time tracking and project planning integrated seamlessly with Trello, consider exploring the [Everhour + Trello time tracking integration](https://everhour.com/integrations/trello).
listing.overview: Free time tracker for Trello. Set estimates, track time, generate detailed reports, export CSV. Unlimited users.

listing.name: Amazing Fields
listing.description:
![Status](https://api.amazingpowerups.com/api/status/amazing-fields)

---
# Make Trello Fit Your Workflow Needs

**How Does It Help You?**

   * ⚙️ **Customize Trello to work in the way you need:** use Amazing Fields to make Trello work for your workflow leveraging easy to use customization.
   * 🗃️ **Organize data in ways that make sense to you and your team:** keep your data and information organized without sacrificing the power of Trello.
   * 🪄 **Add fields with better visuals and more customization than Trello alone:** choose from hundreds of different combinations and features to build exactly what you need.
   * 🔎 **Collect field data on the Trello free plan:** allows fields and customization for free on both Trello free and premium plans.

---

## Join Over 175,000+ Happy Users

Testimonials sent in by users:

  * "It offers to customize EVERYTHING on the fields, it is **what Trello was missing**." - Ana H

  * "I appreciate the continuing updates and responses to my questions from the maintainer.  It **wasn't just a power-up that was made and forgotten about**." - Michael E

  * "It **answered my most annoying problems** with the Trello workflow." - **Ville K**

  * "I can't believe there aren't more apps that offer these features -- **so well done** and thank you so much for developing this!!" - **Cathi B**

  * "This is **one of the best powerups on Trello** I have found in my last 10+ years of using Trello boards. Simply Amazing!!!" - **Yogesh B**

  * "Your Power Up is **awesome**! It should be named Awesome Fields!!" - **Gisele P**


---
## Awards & Recognition

🚀 [Awarded](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/power-up-stats-2022/) Fastest growing PowerUp of 2022!!

🎖️ [Awarded](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/power-up-stats-2021/) #1 New Trello PowerUp of 2021!!

ℹ️ Referenced >100 times by the [Trello community](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/forums/searchpage/tab/message?advanced=false&allow_punctuation=false&q=%22amazing+fields%22)

🗣️ Featured frequently on [How I Trello](https://trello.substack.com/)

----
## What Sets Amazing Fields Apart

I built and refined Amazing Fields based upon feedback from users.  I think this has set Amazing Fields apart from other Trello powerups.

  * **Project Activity:** Amazing Fields is under active development. It was not released and then forgotten about. There are frequent updates providing new fixes and features based upon user feedback.  See the [Amazing Fields Changelog](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/38-amazing-fields-powerup-changelog).

  * **Cost:** I want as many people to use Amazing Fields as possible. It is **freely available for use on as many boards and workspaces as you need**.  See the Supporters section below for more details.

  * **Support:** My goal is to provide the best support of any Trello powerup.  The [Amazing Fields documentation site](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/) has a wide range of articles with more added all the time.  You can also contact me through the support widget in the powerup or email directly at [support@amazingpowerups.com][1].

  * **Security and Data Protection:** Your data is safe and secure on the [Trello trusted servers](https://trello.com/trust).  I have no remote access to your boards or data.


----

![Overview Image](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amazing_fields_overall_guide.png)

**All the options you always wanted to customize Trello but didn’t know to ask**

As a long time users of Trello, I wanted to break out of the limits of the standard workflow and limited data options.  I wanted all the features I have grown to expect from other tools like **formulas**, **customized formatting**, **conditional styling**, **selectable icons**, **easy exports**, and even **progress bars**. I built this powerup to meet my needs and yours as well.

It includes everything you could want:

   * **Field display options** - show on front or back with optional labels and width
   * **Hide Fields** - show only the fields that are needed for each card
   * **Conditional coloring** - change the badge color based upon field values
   * **Reorder fields** - easily reorder fields live for full control
   * **Permissions** - restrict view and edit by user type
   * **Text fields** - collect key information that you need for each card.
   * **Numbers** - track metrics like story points, counts, or any other numbers
   * **Checkbox** - support tracking any on/off style values
   * **Dates** - collect key dates and times to show on the cards
   * **Dropdown** - create a list of preset values and let users choose one or multiple
   * **Formulas** - calculate the value of fields from other field values
   * **Card References** - allow cards reference cards on other boards
   * **Per card visibility** - choose which fields are shown per card
   * **Number formatting** - currency, scientific, percents, accounting and more
   * **Date formatting** - choose everything about how you want to show the date
   * **Progress bars** - use multiple styles to track progress
   * **Multi-select dropdowns** - select multiple items from a dropdown
   * **Checkbox styles** - select from several types of checkboxes
   * **Constraints** - constrain input to specific format templates
   * **Board Exporting** - export all your board and field data to load in a spreadsheet
   * **Text Constraints** - require text fields to match patterns (email, URL, custom...)
   * **Advanced editors** - go beyond the basic field editors
   * **Custom Fields** - ability to integrate with Trello custom fields for automation
   * **Board Backups** - automatically create backups of boards and data
   * And more… - send [new ideas][1]

If there is anything you want and don’t see, [contact me][1] to suggest something new.

---
# Templates / Examples

Take a look at these templates to see what is possible with Amazing Fields. Click on "Create board from template" after you open the links and then click on the "Fields" board button to see the Amazing Fields settings.

   * Feature Examples
      * [Field Features](https://trello.com/b/hGdps9W6)
      * [Progress Bars](https://trello.com/b/0qk7eYed)
      * [Formula Calculations](https://trello.com/b/IGvcw1r5)
   * Usage Examples
      * [Personal Todo](https://trello.com/b/WA8LoWrA)
      * [Amazing Kanban](https://trello.com/b/61fd9fb4107f3075b688c7ca)


# Getting Started

There are a few short steps to get started using the Amazing Fields PowerUp.

See the Amazing Fields docs site for a full walk-thru:

  * [Getting Started](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/18-getting-started)

---

# Details

## Calculated Fields 🖥️

Create formulas just like you do in a spreadsheet to calculate field values from each other.  Supports 100+ of the most common spreadsheet functions.

## Choose Fields to Show Per Card

Make every card just the way you want it by choosing which fields to show. When you copy a card or use a card template, it keeps track of the fields you want to show.

![Field Filter Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_visibility_video.gif)

## Progress Bars 📊

Have you ever wanted to see progress towards a goal on your cards?  Configure the style, width, range and more.  There is support for custom progress bars so you can create anything you imagine.

![Progress Bars Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/progress-bar-fields-linux.png)

You can even setup a progress bar to "link" to the checklists on your card to show a styled progress bar as you make progress on your tasks.

![Checklist Progress Bars](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_checklist_links_video.gif)


## Date Formatting 📅

Choose exactly how you want dates to show on cards.  Dates and times are show in internationalized formats with over 40 variations supported.  Let me know if there is another option that you need.

![Date Formatting Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/date-fields-linux.png)

## Number Formatting 🧮

Select from any combination of number formatting.  All numbers are displayed in the correct  international format, and you can change the number of decimal places in the number.

![Number Formatting Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/number-fields-linux.png)

## Currency Support 💰

Choose to use any of 150+ currency types from around the world.

## Accounting Format 🧾

Supports styling in accounting format to display negative numbers clearly for accountants on your team.


## Customized Checkboxes ☑️

No more being restricted to a single boring check style.  Select from a wide range of options. Every aspect of how you show it is up to you to choose.  Let me know if there are more styles or options I can add to support your use case.

![Checkboxes Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/boolean-fields-linux.png)

## Dropdown Lists

Create a dropdown to choose from a list of choices along with colors to use to decorate the choices.  Very useful for things like card tags, workflow stages, categories, ratings, etc.  You can select one item or multiple items.

![List Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/dropdown_lists.gif)

## Field Display Options 🕵️

You can choose where and how you want your fields to be displayed.  Choose if they should show on the front, the back, or both. Also choose if the field should be labeled or stand alone.

![Display Options Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/field_display_options.gif)

## Tabbed Sections and Headers

Organize fields using section headers and tabs.

![Tabs and Sections Example](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_tabs_headers_video.gif)


## Rule Based Coloring 🎨

Don't use the same boring colors for your fields.  Use formatting rules to set the color based on field values.  You can color progress bars based upon percentage completed, highlight text fields based upon content, monitor key dates, and highlight key checkbox values.  [Let me know][1] if you need a new rule and I will add it for you.

![Rule Coloring](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/rule_based_coloring.gif)

## Text Template Constraints

Setup templates to restrict text input to specific formats (eg. email, phone numbers, URLs, time durations, part numbers, ticket id, etc).  Amazing Fields comes with preset options and lets you define your own as needed.

Need a new preset, [let me know][1].

## Card References

Card references let you connect cards across boards. For example have your project cards reference customer cards or project team members. This lets you build up your boards as databases of cards that can connect in any way you need.

![Card References](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/amf_card_refs_video.gif)

## Custom Editors

No more ugly editors. Immediately see any conditional formatting and visually distinguish the fields.  When you change a value on a progress bar, see it immediately.  If you click on a checkbox you see the custom styled icons.

Even adjust the layout of editors. Set how wide the editors should be and change the way they are labeled.

![Custom Editors](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/custom-editors-linux.png)

## Customize Permissions Per Field

Want to hide some fields from non-administrators or restrict who can edit or view a field?  I built on top of the existing Trello permissions model to let you determine who view/edit each field.  You can require a specific user type or user.  This enables a whole new class of advanced workflows for sharing data across your boards.

![Field Permissions](https://www.amazingpowerups.com/images/amazing_fields_guide/field_permissions.png)

## Exporting Card Data 📋

Amazing Fields allows you to export all the cards on the board including their field data to a CSV file.  This can be loaded in Excel, Google Sheets, or other spreadsheet software for further processing and analysis of your data. You can use this to export both Amazing Fields data or simply to export your normal card data.

## Board Backup

Configure automated backups for your board and all data.  Keep everything safe and secure within your Trello account for easy disaster recovery and archival.

## Custom Field Integration 🤖

As you use fields more, you may want to integrate them into core Trello capabilities like automations, filtering, reporting, and the Trello mobile or integrate with tools like Zapier or other powerups.  Powerups can't directly interface with these capabilities so Amazing Fields lets you link a field to a custom field.  Anytime you change the Amazing Field content it updates the custom field and similarly when you change the value of the custom field it updates the Amazing Field.  This all happens automatically for you behind the scenes.

There are also browser extensions provided to hide the linked custom fields and keep your UI amazingly clean.

---
# Limitations

I hope Amazing Fields does everything you need, but I know there are some use cases where you may need a different tool.

The primary limitation people ask about is that some advanced capabilities like automations and third-party integrations require the use of a paid Trello account.  Trello charges for those features and Amazing Fields does not try to circumvent that.  Instead you need to get a Trello paid plan and link your Amazing Fields to a custom field.

---
# Alternatives

I am glad that you found Amazing Fields, but I know there are other powerups you may be considering for adding data to your cards.

**Trello Custom Fields**: Trello paid plans have support for adding Custom Fields.  These allow you to add basic data to your cards and support automations.  In comparison, Amazing Fields is more focused on advanced features like formulas, formatting, presentation, and customizing fields.

**Smart Fields**: The [Smart Fields](https://trello.com/power-ups/5e2212c3ba57415ef2ef9352) power up allows adding fields to cards.  It's primary focus on on calculations.  In comparison, Amazing Fields not only supports formulas, but also improved data entry, customization, and presentation of field data.

---
# Supporters

Amazing Fields is **freely available for use by as many users, boards, and workspaces as you need**.  There are no limits on it's use.  Once fields are configured and setup they can be used by as many people as you would like on as many boards and workspaces as you need.

I ask that users who feel they are getting value out of Amazing Fields consider becoming a supporter to help me cover the cost of maintenance and hosting the powerup.  Most users do not become supporters, but I greatly appreciate the ones that are. For ~$4/month it helps me ensure the quality of this powerup.

As a way to thank supporters, there are a small set of power user capabilities that require a supporter to configure.  The features are still **completely free** for use by any number of users, boards, and workspaces.

For more details, see this support article: [Amazing Fields Supporters](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/20-amazing-fields-supporters)

If you become a supporter and don't find the additional capabilities useful, just email [support@amazingpowerups.com][1] for a no-questions-asked refund.  I want users to enjoy Amazing Fields. If it isn't working well for you just let me know.

# Contact

To get help or suggest a new features, please contact me directly at [support@amazingpowerups.com][1].  I love feedback and will get back to you as quickly as possible.


# Links
   * [Product Page](https://amazingpowerups.com/product/amazing-fields/)
   * [Documentation / Support](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/)
   * [Privacy Policy](https://amazingpowerups.com/privacy-policy/)
   * [Contact Support][1]


# Release History

Amazing Fields is under active development.  For a full list of changes see: [Amazing Fields Changelog](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/38-amazing-fields-powerup-changelog)

[1]: mailto:support@amazingpowerups.com
listing.overview: Build your custom workflow with extra data for cards with formulas, formatting, styling, custom fields, and everything else you could need.

In comparison, Amazing Fields not only supports formulas, but also improved data entry, customization, and presentation of field data.

---
# Supporters

Amazing Fields is **freely available for use by as many users, boards, and workspaces as you need**.  There are no limits on it's use.  Once fields are configured and setup they can be used by as many people as you would like on as many boards and workspaces as you need.

I ask that users who feel they are getting value out of Amazing Fields consider becoming a supporter to help me cover the cost of maintenance and hosting the powerup.  Most users do not become supporters, but I greatly appreciate the ones that are. For ~$4/month it helps me ensure the quality of this powerup.

As a way to thank supporters, there are a small set of power user capabilities that require a supporter to configure.  The features are still **completely free** for use by any number of users, boards, and workspaces.

For more details, see this support article: [Amazing Fields Supporters](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/20-amazing-fields-supporters)

If you become a supporter and don't find the additional capabilities useful, just email [support@amazingpowerups.com][1] for a no-questions-asked refund.  I want users to enjoy Amazing Fields. If it isn't working well for you just let me know.

# Contact

To get help or suggest a new features, please contact me directly at [support@amazingpowerups.com][1].  I love feedback and will get back to you as quickly as possible.


# Links
   * [Product Page](https://amazingpowerups.com/product/amazing-fields/)
   * [Documentation / Support](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/)
   * [Privacy Policy](https://amazingpowerups.com/privacy-policy/)
   * [Contact Support][1]


# Release History

Amazing Fields is under active development.  For a full list of changes see: [Amazing Fields Changelog](https://docs.amazingpowerups.com/article/38-amazing-fields-powerup-changelog)

    }

- The following format must be followed upon saving in Database
  - `first-name`: 25 char string, lower-case
  - `middle-name`: 25 char string, lower-case
  - `last-name`: 25 char string, lower-case
  - `birth-date`: `LocalDate`
  - `resident-address`:
    - `line-1`: 50 chars, lower cased
    - `line-2`: 50 chars, lower cased
    - `city`: 25 chars, lower cased
    - `zip`: number 5 digits
  - `id`: 20 chars, lower-cased

    - PASSPORT
    - STUDENT-ID
    - DRIVER-ID
    - GOV-ID

- 204 response code
- new record must be in the list of users
